etymology.description: 目(目) (mù, "eye") + 人(人) (rén, "person") = person looking back -> concept of disobedience or limit
etymology.interpretation: The combination of a person 人(人) and an eye 目(目) suggests a person looking back, symbolizing a sense of limit or resistance. This character conveys the idea of hesitation or stopping.

examples.pinyin: Gèn yě shì bāguà zhī yī.
examples.english: Gen is also one of the trigrams.
